job_description:
• Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, AI, Machine Learning, Data Science or related field in their last year.
• Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work in fast-paced, agile environments.
• Ability to design, implement, and manage context-aware systems that leverage Model Context Protocol (MCP) to maintain continuity across user interactions, including prompt engineering, memory management, and context window optimization for large language models.
• Knowledge with scalable context management solutions including retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), semantic chunking, and memory persistence for long-horizon tasks Integration & Enablement: Connect AI agents with enterprise systems (e.
• , SharePoint, M365), external APIs, knowledge bases, and ensure seamless interoperability.
• Continuous Improvement: Collect feedback, iterate solutions, and contribute to a culture of innovation and scalability.
• Knowledge of common development languages.
• Net, C#, Python, Java, API development, SQL, PowerShell, Unix shell scripting Familiarity with agent orchestration frameworks and multi-agent systems using A2A (Agent to Agent).

• Work with QA and Engineering to validate that security requirements (like authZ scopes or encryption) are actually implemented correctly in the final code.
• Security Mindset: Experience looking at a system design and identifying where it might break.
• Communication Skills: You can explain a security risk to a Data Scientist without using jargon, and you can explain an ML constraint to a Security Engineer.
• Strong Engineering Foundation: 2+ years of software engineering experience.
• You write clean, tested code (Python preferred) and understand the SDLC.
• Previous experience in an embedded, automotive, or IoT environment (understanding that code eventually runs on a vehicle or physical hardware).
• Experience using or securing Vector Databases or LLM orchestrators (like LangChain).
• Experience with AWS or GCP cloud security architecture.

• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to meet software engineering requirements.
• In this role, you will play a key part in defining software requirements, designing embedded solutions, and verifying system performance, ensuring our maintenance systems meet the evolving needs of modern aircraft.
• The ideal candidate will bring hands‑on experience with system‑level testing, REST APIs, structured data formats, and embedded or IoT platforms to ensure the reliability, performance, and compliance of technologies deployed across mission‑critical environments worldwide.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to meet software engineering requirements.
